missed.title: Cross-Site Scripting in Input Value
missed.reason: The expected XSS vulnerability in the input value attribute (app.py line 66) was not identified in the actual penetration test findings. The test focused on infrastructure and configuration issues (security headers, API endpoints, server headers) but did not perform input-based XSS testing or code analysis at the specified file location. This could indicate the test did not execute or analyze the vulnerable code path.

extra.title: Missing Critical Security Headers
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate finding representing a new vulnerability discovery. The test identified multiple missing security headers (X-Frame-Options, CSP, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options, HSTS, X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies, Referrer-Policy) that were not in the expected findings list. This is a valid security issue independent of the expected XSS vulnerability.

extra.title: Inaccessible or Non-Functional API - No Endpoints Available
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate finding representing a critical infrastructure discovery. The test found that only the root (/) endpoint is functional, with all API endpoints (/api, /api/users, /login, /dashboard, /challenges, etc.) returning HTTP 404. This represents a complete absence of API functionality and was not included in the expected findings.

extra.title: Server Version Information Disclosure
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate finding representing a new vulnerability discovery. The test identified that the Server header reveals 'Werkzeug/1.0.1 Python/2.7.18', exposing sensitive version information about outdated and end-of-life software versions. This information disclosure vulnerability was not in the expected findings list.
